revised_title: The Effects of Magnesia and Acids on Uric Acid Formation and Urine Composition
tldr: This study investigates the effects of magnesia and various acids on preventing the formation of uric acid and treating disorders related to kidney stones. Magnesia is found to be effective in preventing the formation of red sand, while mineral acids can cause a return of red gravel. Vegetable acids, such as citric and tartaric, are less likely to produce this side effect and are recommended for treatment.
